review: The chromecast is awesome.  I buy my movies thrpough google play more than anything else these days (I don't even remember the last time I bought a DVD or BlueRay).  Super duper easy to just switch over my input and play my movies.Honestly, I usually use this when I am sitting around, working on stuff and want to have youtube going as well, I just add stuff to my play list and it goes.  There is no hassel or fuss (not that it is hard to connect my computer, but I can launch from my phones and tablets too).There are lots of other services that are great - HBOGo, Crackle, Pandora, Hulu, Starz (some of these require subscriptions) and lots more (see the list at http://www.google.com/chrome/devices/chromecast/apps.html#marquee-slide-hbo-go)There are a couple things that I think I should share for anyone looking into this:-It needs to have a wifi network to stream across.  If you are in a hotel and want to use this, you will not be able to.-If you use only static IPs on your network - you will have problems with this.-If you want to watch your movies that you have locally on your computer - you will need to use Plex (last time I checked, there was a fee for this service).
